verses.kjv: For yourselves, brethren, know our entrance in unto you, that it was not in vain:
verses.web: For you yourselves know, brothers, our visit to you wasn’t in vain,
verses.ct: Brothers, you already know that our visit to you wasn't wasted.

verses.kjv: But even after that we had suffered before, and were shamefully entreated, as ye know, at Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the gospel of God with much contention.
verses.web: but having suffered before and been shamefully treated, as you know, at Philippi, we grew bold in our God to tell you the Good News of God in much conflict.
verses.ct: As you know, we had already been beaten and publicly humiliated in Philippi. But even so, God gave us the courage to share his gospel with you despite fierce opposition.

verses.kjv: For our exhortation was not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile:
verses.web: For our exhortation is not of error, nor of uncleanness, nor in deception.
verses.ct: Our message to you didn't come from false motives, impure intentions, or any kind of trickery.

verses.kjv: But as we were allowed of God to be put in trust with the gospel, even so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, which trieth our hearts.
verses.web: But even as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the Good News, so we speak: not as pleasing men, but God, who tests our hearts.
verses.ct: God himself approved us and entrusted us with the gospel, so that's exactly how we speak — not to win people's approval, but to please God, who examines our hearts.

verses.kjv: For neither at any time used we flattering words, as ye know, nor a cloke of covetousness; God is witness:
verses.web: For neither were we at any time found using words of flattery, as you know, nor a cloak of covetousness (God is witness),
verses.ct: You know we never used flattery, and we never disguised greed behind our message. God is our witness.

verses.kjv: Nor of men sought we glory, neither of you, nor yet of others, when we might have been burdensome, as the apostles of Christ.
verses.web: nor seeking glory from men (neither from you nor from others), when we might have claimed authority as apostles of Christ.
verses.ct: We never chased after praise from anyone — not from you, not from anyone else — even though as apostles of Christ we could have made demands on you.

verses.kjv: But we were gentle among you, even as a nurse cherisheth her children:
verses.web: But we were gentle among you, like a nursing mother cherishes her own children.
verses.ct: Instead, we were gentle with you, like a nursing mother tenderly caring for her own children.

verses.kjv: So being affectionately desirous of you, we were willing to have imparted unto you, not the gospel of God only, but also our own souls, because ye were dear unto us.
verses.web: Even so, affectionately longing for you, we were well pleased to impart to you, not the Good News of God only, but also our own souls, because you had become very dear to us.
verses.ct: We loved you so deeply that we were happy to share not only God's gospel with you but our very lives as well, because you had become so dear to us.

verses.kjv: For ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring night and day, because we would not be chargeable unto any of you, we preached unto you the gospel of God.
verses.web: For you remember, brothers, our labor and travail; for working night and day, that we might not burden any of you, we preached to you the Good News of God.
verses.ct: Brothers, you remember how hard we worked. We labored night and day so we wouldn't be a financial burden to any of you while we preached God's gospel to you.

verses.kjv: Ye are witnesses, and God also, how holily and justly and unblameably we behaved ourselves among you that believe:
verses.web: You are witnesses with God how holy, righteously, and blamelessly we behaved ourselves toward you who believe.
verses.ct: You are witnesses, and so is God, of how pure, upright, and blameless our conduct was among you who believe.

verses.kjv: As ye know how we exhorted and comforted and charged every one of you, as a father doth his children,
verses.web: As you know, we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children,
verses.ct: You know that we treated each one of you the way a father treats his own children — encouraging you, comforting you, and urging you

verses.kjv: That ye would walk worthy of God, who hath called you unto his kingdom and glory.
verses.web: to the end that you should walk worthily of God, who calls you into his own Kingdom and glory.
verses.ct: to live in a way that honors God, who calls you into his own kingdom and glory.

verses.kjv: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing, because, when ye received the word of God which ye heard of us, ye received it not as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which effectually worketh also in you that believe.
verses.web: For this cause we also thank God without ceasing, that when you received from us the word of the message of God, you accepted it not as the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of God, which also works in you who believe.
verses.ct: This is also why we constantly thank God: when you heard the word of God from us, you didn't receive it as just a human message. You accepted it for what it truly is — the word of God — and it is actively at work in you who believe.

verses.kjv: For ye, brethren, became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for ye also have suffered like things of your own countrymen, even as they have of the Jews:
verses.web: For you, brothers, became imitators of the assemblies of God which are in Judea in Christ Jesus; for you also suffered the same things from your own countrymen, even as they did from the Jews
verses.ct: Brothers, you followed the example of God's churches in Judea that belong to Christ Jesus. You suffered the same kind of persecution from your own people that they suffered from the Jews —

verses.kjv: Who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:
verses.web: who killed both the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and drove us out, and don’t please God, and are contrary to all men,
verses.ct: the same people who killed the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and who drove us out. They don't please God and are hostile to everyone,

verses.kjv: Forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they might be saved, to fill up their sins alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.
verses.web: forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles that they may be saved, to fill up their sins always. But wrath has come on them to the uttermost.
verses.ct: trying to stop us from speaking to the Gentiles so they can be saved. In doing this, they keep piling up their sins to the limit. But God's wrath has finally caught up with them completely.

verses.kjv: But we, brethren, being taken from you for a short time in presence, not in heart, endeavoured the more abundantly to see your face with great desire.
verses.web: But we, brothers, being bereaved of you for a short season, in presence, not in heart, tried even harder to see your face with great desire,
verses.ct: Brothers, when we were torn away from you for a short time — physically, not in our hearts — we tried even harder, with intense longing, to see you again face to face.

verses.kjv: Wherefore we would have come unto you, even I Paul, once and again; but Satan hindered us.
verses.web: because we wanted to come to you—indeed, I, Paul, once and again—but Satan hindered us.
verses.ct: We wanted to come back to you — I, Paul, tried more than once — but Satan blocked our way.

verses.kjv: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Are not even ye in the presence of our Lord Jesus Christ at his coming?
verses.web: For what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? Isn’t it even you, before our Lord Jesus at his coming?
verses.ct: After all, what is our hope, our joy, our crown of rejoicing? Isn't it you — standing before our Lord Jesus when he returns?

verses.kjv: For ye are our glory and joy.
verses.web: For you are our glory and our joy.
verses.ct: You truly are our glory and our joy.
